alert.note: Alert for Blair; Cambria; Clearfield; Cumberland; Dauphin; Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin; Northern Centre; Perry; Southern Centre (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 6:58AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 657 AM EST, a band of heavy snow was 12 miles northwest of Tyrone moving southeast at 45 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Houtzdale around 700 AM EST. Blandburg around 705 AM EST. Tyrone, Tipton and Bald Eagle around 715 AM EST. Birmingham, Sinking Valley and Warriors Mark around 720 AM EST. Spruce Creek and Franklinville around 725 AM EST. Huntingdon around 740 AM EST. This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 206 to 227. Interstate 81 from mile markers 34 to 52. Interstate 99 from mile markers 42 to 63. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
